| The damaged arcadian avenger:* has [no eyes](/wiki/Eyeless "Eyeless").
* has no hands.
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is female.
* lets you close unless attacked.
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming").
* [does not move](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile"). |                                                                                                                        |

The **damaged arcadian avenger**, 7, is the [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader") for the [Gnomish Ranger quest](/wiki/Gnomish_Ranger_quest "Gnomish Ranger quest") in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). She is a [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid"), female [lawful angelic being](/wiki/Lawful_angels_and_minions "Lawful angels and minions") that is [sessile](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile") and treated as not having [eyes](/wiki/Eyes "Eyes") or [hands](/wiki/Hands "Hands"), which is flavored to be the results of the extensive damage she has taken.

The damaged arcadian avenger has no attacks unlike a normal [arcadian avenger](/wiki/Arcadian_avenger "Arcadian avenger"), and possesses [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

## Generation

The damaged arcadian avenger is always generated peaceful, and is not a valid form for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

The damaged arcadian avenger is generated in the closet behind the [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") of [Ruggo the Gnome High King](/index.php?title=Ruggo_the_Gnome_High_King\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ruggo the Gnome High King (page does not exist)") on the Gnomish Ranger quest's home floor at level creation - the closet can be accessed through a [secret door](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door").

## Origin

The Arcadian avenger (capitalized to reflect their primary realm) is a being that appears in *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, and is first introduced in the 2007 *Monster Manual V* for 3.5e. An Arcadian avenger is a type of militant outsider that acts as a defender of the lawful planes of Arcadia and the House of the Triad. Accordingly, Arcadian avengers are all lawful: most were of a lawful good bent, but several dispassionately value the rule of law over benevolence and are lawful neutral. All Arcadian avengers look remarkably similar, resembling athletic human women whose skin and wings are seemingly made of a silver-like metal; they also wear armor made of a similar metal, and are typically equipped with a pair of masterfully crafted [long swords](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword").

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Damaged_arcadian_avenger\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Damaged arcadian avenger

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
7 damaged arcadian avenger (No tile)
Difficulty 7
Attacks None
7 damaged arcadian avenger (No tile)
Difficulty 7
Attacks

None

Base level 6
Base experience 97
Speed 9
Base AC 3
Base MR 0
Alignment 5 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1014
Nutritional value 0
Size medium
Resistances cold, sleep, shock, poison

The damaged arcadian avenger:

  • has no eyes.
  • has no hands.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is female.
  • lets you close unless attacked.
  • cannot be tamed.
  • does not move.

The damaged arcadian avenger, 7, is the quest leader for the Gnomish Ranger quest in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. She is a humanoid, female lawful angelic being that is sessile and treated as not having eyes or hands, which is flavored to be the results of the extensive damage she has taken.

The damaged arcadian avenger has no attacks unlike a normal arcadian avenger, and possesses cold resistance, sleep resistance, shock resistance, and poison resistance.

Generation

The damaged arcadian avenger is always generated peaceful, and is not a valid form for polymorph.

The damaged arcadian avenger is generated in the closet behind the throne of Ruggo the Gnome High King on the Gnomish Ranger quest's home floor at level creation - the closet can be accessed through a secret door.

Origin

The Arcadian avenger (capitalized to reflect their primary realm) is a being that appears in Dungeons & Dragons, and is first introduced in the 2007 Monster Manual V for 3.5e. An Arcadian avenger is a type of militant outsider that acts as a defender of the lawful planes of Arcadia and the House of the Triad. Accordingly, Arcadian avengers are all lawful: most were of a lawful good bent, but several dispassionately value the rule of law over benevolence and are lawful neutral. All Arcadian avengers look remarkably similar, resembling athletic human women whose skin and wings are seemingly made of a silver-like metal; they also wear armor made of a similar metal, and are typically equipped with a pair of masterfully crafted long swords.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

The '''damaged arcadian avenger''', {{brightcyan|7}}, is the [[quest leader]] for the [[Gnomish Ranger quest]] in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. She is a [[humanoid]], female [[Lawful angels and minions|lawful angelic being]] that is [[sessile]] and treated as not having [[eyes]] or [[hands]], which is flavored to be the results of the extensive damage she has taken.

The damaged arcadian avenger has no attacks unlike a normal [[arcadian avenger]], and possesses [[cold resistance]], [[sleep resistance]], [[shock resistance]], and [[poison resistance]].

==Generation==
The damaged arcadian avenger is always generated peaceful, and is not a valid form for [[polymorph]].

The damaged arcadian avenger is generated in the closet behind the [[throne]] of [[Ruggo the Gnome High King]] on the Gnomish Ranger quest's home floor at level creation - the closet can be accessed through a [[secret door]].

==Origin==
The Arcadian avenger (capitalized to reflect their primary realm) is a being that appears in ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', and is first introduced in the 2007 ''Monster Manual V'' for 3.5e. An Arcadian avenger is a type of militant outsider that acts as a defender of the lawful planes of Arcadia and the House of the Triad. Accordingly, Arcadian avengers are all lawful: most were of a lawful good bent, but several dispassionately value the rule of law over benevolence and are lawful neutral. All Arcadian avengers look remarkably similar, resembling athletic human women whose skin and wings are seemingly made of a silver-like metal; they also wear armor made of a similar metal, and are typically equipped with a pair of masterfully crafted [[long sword]]s.
